Package com.intellij.openapi.fileTypes

Interface FileType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Scheme
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CustomSyntaxTableFileType, DirectoryFileType, FileTypeIdentifiableByVirtualFile, INativeFileType, InternalFileType, UIBasedFileType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFileType, ArchiveFileType, BuildoutCfgFileType, CommandLineFileType, DictionaryFileType, DTDFileType, EclipseFileType, EnforcedPlainTextFileType, FakeFileType, GitExcludeFileType, GitIgnoreFileType, GroovyFileType, GuiFormFileType, HgIgnoreFileType, HtmlFileType, IgnoreFileType, ImageFileType, JavaClassFileType, JavaFileType, JqlFileType, JShellFileType, Json5FileType, JsonFileType, JsonSchemaFileType, LanguageFileType, ManifestFileType, MarkdownFileType, MockLanguageFileType, ModuleFileType, NativeFileType, PatchFileType, PlainTextFileType, ProjectFileType, PropertiesFileType, PyDocstringFileType, PyFunctionTypeAnnotationFileType, PyiFileType, PythonFileType, QtFileType, QtUIFileType, RegExpFileType, ResourceBundleFileType, RestFileType, RncFileType, ScratchFileType, ShFileType, SPIFileType, SubstitutedFileType, SvgFileType, TemplateDataElementType.TemplateFileType, TerminalSessionFileType, TextMateFileType, UiScriptFileType, UnknownFileType, UserBinaryFileType, UserFileType, WorkspaceFileType, XHtmlFileType, XmlFileType, XmlLikeFileType, XPathFileType, YAMLFileType, YouTrackFileType

    public interface FileType
extends Scheme
    Describes a filetype.

    Must be registered via com.intellij.fileType extension point or FileTypeFactory. If file type depends on given file, FileTypeIdentifiableByVirtualFile can be used for non-static mapping.

    Use LanguageFileType for files having Language support.

    See Also:
    StdFileTypes, FileTypes, INativeFileType

      • EMPTY_ARRAY

        static final FileType[] EMPTY_ARRAY

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the file type. The name must be unique among all file types registered in the system.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Scheme
        Returns:
        The file type name.

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns the user-readable description of the file type.
        Returns:
        The file type description.

      • getDefaultExtension

        java.lang.String getDefaultExtension()
        Returns the default extension for files of the type.
        Returns:
        The extension, not including the leading '.'.

      • getIcon

        javax.swing.Icon getIcon()
        Returns the icon used for showing files of the type.
        Returns:
        The icon instance, or null if no icon should be shown.

      • isBinary

        boolean isBinary()
        Returns true if files of the specified type contain binary data. Used for source control, to-do items scanning and other purposes.
        Returns:
        true if the file is binary, false if the file is plain text.

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns true if the specified file type is read-only. Read-only file types are not shown in the "File Types" settings dialog, and users cannot change the extensions associated with the file type.
        Returns:
        true if the file type is read-only, false otherwise.

      • getCharset

        java.lang.String getCharset(VirtualFile file,
                            byte [] content)
        Returns the character set for the specified file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file for which the character set is requested.
        content - File content.
        Returns:
        The character set name, in the format supported by Charset class.
